subtitles.dialogue_text: Studio Ghibli, Nippon Television Network, Dentsu, Hakuhodo DYMP, Walt Disney Japan, Mitsubishi, Toho and KDDI present
The wind is rising. We must try to live.
It's in English. I have a dictionary.
Very good. Give it a go. Thank you.
Fighting is never justified. I know.
I was waiting for you. Let's pick bamboo grass.
I want to pick bamboo grass.
You promised to go with me.
He is a famous Italian aircraft designer.
His name is Caproni. It says he is a count.
Your face is scratched. Leave it alone.
I better put some iodine on it.
Big brother, what are you doing?
Focusing on the stars should improve my eyesight.
Mother will scold you. A shooting star!
There is so many of them.
I think this is my dream.
This is my dream, you know.
Listen, Japanese boy. You think we are sharing this dream?
You're Count Caproni, aren't you? I'm very glad to meet you.
Interesting. Yes, this is a dream. This world is a dream.
They will bomb the enemy city. Most of them won't return.
But the war will soon be over.
This is my dream. When the war is over, I will build this.
Instead of bombs, she'll carry passengers.
Of course we can't climb up here...
but dreams are convenient. One can go anywhere.
Come, join me. You can walk along the spar.
She is beautiful, no? Yes, incredible.
She'll carry a hundred people across the Atlantic.
Mr. Caproni? I have a question.
Do you think I could design airplanes?
I'll never be a pilot. I'm too nearsighted.
I'm not a pilot. I don't even know how to fly.
But I am a creator of airplanes. An aeronautical engineer.
Airplanes are not tools for war. They are not for making money.
Jiro, you should go to bed.
You startled me. I heard you talking to someone.
Mother, I'm going to be an aeronautical engineer.
Airplanes are beautiful dreams. That's what he told me.
I want to design beautiful airplanes.
You, there. Come, take my seat.
"Le vent se lève. Il faut tenter de vivre."
"The wind is rising. We must try to live."
The boiler is going to blow!
It's broken. She can't walk like this.
Miss, the boiler. Please save yourself.
She can't walk. Where do you live?
In Ueno. I'll get you there.
What about your luggage? It's not important.
One of my shirts. It's brand new.
The well is almost dry. What about you?
I'm heading for the university. What about you?
Look after this, Kinu. I will.
We'll be back soon. Don't worry.
Thank you. I'll leave her to you.
That was some guy. Don't you think, Kinu?
Jiro! You picked a great day to come back.
The whole east side is burning.
A flying door? That's just great. They'll never stop the fire now.
He really built it. Caproni has giant dreams.
The wind is shifting. It's coming this way.
Is the wind still rising, Japanese boy?
Then you must live. "Le vent se lève."
All the new buildings are old-fashioned.
Every day is the same. Same lunch, same lectures.
The Western powers are building all-metal aircraft.
We're more than ten years behind.
You eat mackerel to look at the bones?
Come on, finish up. We're going for coffee.
Is Mr. Horikoshi back from lunch?
The NACA has a standard curve just like this bone.
A lady brought this for you, sir.
You were out, so she left it with me.
Hello, Mr. Horikoshi. Back from school.
Your guest is waiting. A young lady.
Is she staying there? Just for one night.
You've grown, Kayo. And gotten very pretty too.
You're so mean. You never ever come home.
I'll tell them I kept you. Let's take the penny steamer.
Come on, it's been two years.
Didn't you try to see her again?
Of course. I went back once.
The fire stopped at her street.
I'm fine. I never dreamed Tokyo would recover so quickly.
Can I stay with you, Jiro?
Father won't let me live here by myself.
I'll probably be in Nagoya by the time you come.
I want to study medicine in Tokyo.
A doctor? I think you might be a good one.
I'll talk to Father next time I'm home.
We are on our way. Yes, we are.
They must've been heading for the city.
There is no work in the countryside.
Another bank failure. Which one is it this time?
Are those the customers? Looks like it.
The economy is in the tank. So is our new employer.
We've been waiting for you. What took you so long?
I was told to come anytime in April.
Then you should've come in March.
I've got an assignment for you.
It's the design for the wing strut fitting.
I need it right away. We're behind schedule already.
The data is ready. This way.
It's imported, but no one likes it.
Listen up! The Falcon Project has a new engineer.
He is the genius we've all been hearing about.
The assembly plant? Yes, I'd like to take a look.
Asking a green engineer to design that fitting is practically hazing.
Excuse me. Could we ask a favor?
Sorry to bother you on your break.
Not at all. You young engineers should visit us more often.
Honjo, the strut is already installed.
Kurokawa is just hazing you. Is his fitting better than yours?
Mr. Kurokawa is always hard on new employees.
Honjo, get up here and take a look.
What do you think? Looks strong enough.
This is no good. It's just like my design.
Maybe they are, but we're late.
Mr. Hattori is our chief engineer.
The strut fitting for the Falcon.
That's no fitting. Explain yourself, young man.
Yes sir. This leaf spring will absorb stress from the wing.
The wire expands and contracts automatically.
It runs through the strut to an anchor on the fuselage.
But we'd have to redesign the wing.
You're right. I haven't done the calculations yet.
You're wasting your time. Where is the assignment I gave you?
That looks like a very clean design to me.
Submit your work as soon as you finish!
They haul prototypes to the airfield.
The latest aircraft, hauled by oxen. That's how backward we are.
Did you get it? 13.3 seconds. 145 knots.
Too slow. We need ten more knots.
She is too low. The engine is not performing.
Another coup for Mitsubishi. Your Falcon is quite impressive.
Power dive. She is trying to break 200.
Parachute is open. Go get him!
Mr. Kurokawa, we'll investigate the cause when the weather clears.
What about the pilot? He is okay.
Mr. Kurokawa, let's go. We'll build Falcon Two.
Do you think the strut fitting failed?
No. I think the problem is deeper and more complicated.
I'll never forget what I saw today.
It's like an endless road is opening up before my eyes.
There won't be a Falcon Two.
The Army has decided to go with a competing design.
Today was our last chance to change their minds.
We're going to build a bomber with help from Junkers.
This is your chance to see Germany. I've already approved it.
Two slices of the usual. Coming up.
Their parents work late. They wait there every night.
I feel bad closing the place up.
You must be hungry. Here is something to eat.
It's sponge cake. I just bought it.
Too bad about the Falcon. I heard they axed it.
Sponge cake? You have some strange eating habits.
Did you think she was going to smile and say thank you?
There are dozens of hungry kids right here in this neighborhood.
The cost of one fitting would feed that kid's family for a month.
Jiro, do you know what we're paying the Germans for their technology?
Enough to feed every kid in Japan, with sponge cake for dessert.
Still, I plan to make the most of this opportunity.
They're sending you too? They told me today.
So they pay us a lot to design them. It's ironic.
I'm leaving for Tokyo tomorrow. Getting married.
To work hard at the office, you need a family at home.
Tight-fisted Germans. They are hardly showing us anything.
The airstrip is next to the plant.
It's the G-38. Is this what we are buying?
For conversion to a bomber. It's top secret.
Who is the Army planning to bomb with this thing?
America, probably. Not that they could.
Passengers can sit in the wings. This would be wasted as a bomber.
Who cares? We need their all-metal airframe technology.
You're kidding. We can't go inside?
Stop it. Take your hands off him.
Is this how Germans treat their guests?
You Japanese copy everything. This technology belongs to Germany.
Come on. Japan has lots of planes like this.
We have a license to your technology.
We signed an agreement. We have the right to be here.
Your bosses never said we couldn't inspect this airplane.
I'm sure you're only trying to do your job,
but we won't tolerate this treatment. The agreement is between equals.
Our orders were not to let you Japanese wander around.
You can go inside. Dr. Junkers has agreed.
I'm surprised we got a demonstration.
There's more vibration than I expected.
Let the Army officers sit here.
This is truly a stupendous aircraft.
Look, a corridor through the wing.
It's like being inside a power plant.
Guten tag. Dr. Junkers gave us permission.
Please show us your work station.
This is the flight engineer's station.
This is incredible. Yes, it's fantastic.
A triumph of German industrial technology.
Dr. Junkers is my hero, but his company is sneaky.
It looks cold outside, but this room is cozy.
Junkers makes radiators too. This almost looks like that plane.
And our technology is primitive. That's what you mean, right?
You think we'll never figure out all-metal construction on our own?
We can't learn anything from this.
Maybe we don't even need their technology.
Wood and canvas could be as good as metal.
Then we'll never make it. We're already 20 years behind.
We're Achilles, chasing a tortoise with a twenty-year lead.
If we close the gap in five years,
he'll be five more years down the road.
Someday we'll overtake him and move ahead.
I wonder if we can be the tortoise.
Schubert's "Winter Journey". It's perfect for us.
What was that about? We saw him in the hangar.
I'm done. Go have a bath.
with a face like he is carrying the future of Japanese aviation.
There is a telegram from headquarters.
Some of us are returning immediately. You're staying behind.
Jiro will continue west and return to Japan.
West? They want him to see the world.
Then I invite you to join me on my final flight. Come.
There is a hatch under the fuselage.
My workmen's families and relatives. Practically the whole village.
before we deliver this bomber to the Air Force.
What do you think? It's incredible.
It's like a building out of ancient Rome.
This plane is too large to be used for war,
but the Air Force likes everything big.
We could never build something like this.
The important thing for an engineer is inspiration.
Inspiration unlocks the future. Technology will catch up.
We Italians are also poor. Too many mouths to feed.
Hey, settle down. The bottom will fall out.
Be careful. This may be a dream, but you can still lose your head.
Which would you choose, a world with pyramids or one without them?
Humanity dreams of flight, but the dream is cursed.
Aircraft are destined to become tools for slaughter and destruction.
But still, I chose a world with pyramids in it.
I want to create beautiful airplanes.
I have a long way to go. I don't even have the engine yet.
I'm retiring. This is my last design.
Artists are only creative for ten years.
Live your ten years to the full.
I've got a meeting. Cancel it.
This is a tall order. They're always tall.
How long have you been with us, Jiro?
You should be ready, then. We want you to lead the project.
It's the Navy's design competition for 1932. A carrier-based fighter.
I'd like Honjo on the team.
You'd end up competing. Friendship is more important.
We've got other plans for Honjo.
And damn this short flight deck.
That was kind of you. Are you all right?
Thank you. It belongs to the hotel.
Father, I'm afraid I was rude to that man.
Don't worry. He is staying at our hotel.
You'll have a chance to say thank you.
Nothing. Just that man who caught the parasol.
He seems to be here by himself.
No, please stay. I was giving thanks to the spring.
I asked it to bring you here to me.
You haven't changed at all. You're just like you were then.
We were so grateful for your help after the earthquake.
I wanted to see you again and thank you.
Kinu got married two days after she dropped off your shirt.
She cried for joy when we found you.
You were our knight in shining armor.
You were like a knight on a white horse that day.
She just had her second child.
Yes. I'll keep it this way in honor of today.
I'd almost forgotten what rainbows look like.
We'd better go. Father is probably worried sick.
Don't worry, Father. I'm fine. Mr. Horikoshi saved me again.
Satomi. I'm afraid my daughter has caused you trouble again.
German tobacco. Last one. Too bad.
I know how you feel. The same thing happened to me.
You visit Germany, yes? To Dessau.
You read German magazines. Magazines about airplanes.
Dr. Junkers is in trouble. What kind of trouble?
He fights the government. He will blow up.
The Nazis are a gang of hoodlums.
No mosquitoes. Not hot. Good watercress.
A good place to forget bad things.
It is a nice night. Hier ist der Zauberberg.
Make a war in China. Forget it.
Make a puppet state in Manchuria. Forget it.
Quit the League of Nations. Forget it.
Make the world your enemy. Forget it.
Will Germany go to war again? Yes. They must be stopped.
I'm sorry to keep you waiting so long.
I'm afraid we'll have to cancel our dinner plans.
I'm sorry. Please tell her I hope she feels better.
I must go. The doctor will be here soon.
"But when the leaves hang trembling, the wind is passing through."
Is the young lady feeling better?
This is the magic mountain. It cures everyone.
At first, this young man was very gloomy.
You will go down the mountain. You will forget what happened here.
This person you're talking about wouldn't be my daughter, would it?
But first, there is something I have to tell you.
Two years ago, my mother died of tuberculosis.
I've loved you since that day you rescued my hat.
I've loved you since the wind brought you to me.
But I want to get well first. Can you wait for me?
Even if it takes a hundred years.
He is a nice young man. Your daughter is wonderful.
When did you get back? Two days ago.
It's a radical design. They gave me free rein.
But we won't know until she flies.
She'll fly. I feel the wind rising.
You're the Japanese Achilles. You've closed the gap.
My plane was just a tin duckling.
I have an idea for you.
Use flathead screws on the access hatches.
Maintenance will be easy with a hinge on one side.
A spring about this stiff should be fine.
That's a great idea, like Columbus and his egg.
After you use it, I'll use it too.
The Special Police are looking for you.
I told them you were away on business.
Pretending to leave? We won't fall for that.
You'd better work here. We'll bring your things.
What's going on? Why are they after me?
They arrested some of my friends. None of them understood why.
Just leave it and go. Jiro, it's here!
Wish we'd had it last year.
Our next plane will be a full-grown duck, not a duckling.
Extruded aluminum alloy. Very light. What a luxury.
The coast looks clear. Okay, Jiro.
Better lie low for a few days.
Let me stop by my apartment. I'm expecting a letter.
The police will be opening your mail.
Such things shouldn't happen in a modern country.
Jiro is human after all. Splendid.
You think Japan is a modern country?
Of course it's not funny. The police are waiting for you.
Let them read your love letters.
The Navy's next design competition is in your hands.
The company will protect you. That is, as long as you're useful.
Just keep your mind on work.
I miss you terribly. And "Mr. Castorp" left so suddenly.
Why are they looking for him?
I pray that he managed to leave Japan safely.
The telephone is there. Thank you.
Hello? Jiro? You have a telegram.
Your landlord brought it. It came two days ago.
What's the fastest way to get to Tokyo?
I have to be there as soon as possible.
If you take the noon bus, you can catch the express.
I'll send someone to hold the bus for you.
I wish I could've come sooner.
Father, Jiro came to see me.
But he has to leave right away.
Next time I'll use the front door. Use the garden, it's more fun.
The last train? You'd better hurry.
Is it that serious? I wish I could look after her.
The way to do that is to focus on your work.
I'm going to the sanatorium the doctor recommended.
But it's so lonely. You'll be all by yourself.
I want a life with Jiro.
You're just in time. The board is waiting.
Now the Navy. They're the client.
So I gave up on that idea.
Everyone is here rather late. Jiro is holding a design seminar.
The next design uses all the latest technology.
I thought the Navy requested 220 knots.
Wing loading is 120 kilos per square meter.
We'll minimize drag and push the limits of technology.
She'll have split flaps and leading edge slats.
But then weight becomes a problem.
If we leave out the guns, we should be okay.
I decided to set this idea aside for now.
This is delightful. Lucid and logical.
To compensate, we need a light, strong structure.
We'll cut excess weight and minimize drag with a smooth skin.
We're going to build an all-metal fighter
like nothing the world has ever seen.
Mr. Hirayama is our production engineer.
He is going to tell us about the new rivets.
It's technically possible to build strong structures with flush rivets.
We're going to skin the whole aircraft with flush rivets.
I must say that was interesting.
I'll call back. I think it's an emergency.
Thank goodness. I worried I wouldn't find you.
I'm here now. Can you walk?
I just had to see you. I should go right back.
What a charming companion. My name is Nahoko.
So you're Nahoko. Jiro, is that you?
We've come to you with a request.
Why not, dear? It'll be fine.
but I can hardly approve of an unmarried couple living together.
Mr. Kurokawa, Mrs. Kurokawa, please be our witnesses.
Nahoko was very brave to leave the sanatorium.
My father's given his permission. I've already told the doctor.
The bride and I have preparations to make.
Don't worry, he is always like that.
If you care about her, you'll send her back immediately.
I can't do that. I'd have to give up my work.
Is that your heart or your ego talking?
We don't have much time. We've made our decision.
All right. We'll have a real ceremony.
Hear me! This lovely maiden has traveled far to join her beloved.
She's given up everything in the world for him. What say you?
Hear me! This man is an insensitive simpleton
without a home of his own.
If that's..., okay with you, please come in.
Then they will exchange the marriage vows.
No words can express our gratitude for your kindness.
We will never forget our debt to you.
Come now, we're delighted that Jiro's found such a wonderful partner.
Of course. This is wonderful. You're both very courageous.
I feel like I'm dreaming. The room is spinning.
Do you always get home this late?
I came on behalf of the family to thank the Kurokawas.
What are you going to do? She is alone in that room all day.
Her condition is much worse than you think.
I'm an intern. I know something about this.
Did you notice she uses rouge every morning so you won't worry?
I really like Nahoko. She is such a good person.
How can you do this to her?
Does she really have to stay here?
Each day is very precious to us now.
Get some rest. I'm glad you came to visit.
I was waiting. You should sleep.
Should you be up? Kayo came today.
She is like the sun, with such a bright future.
She said next time, she'll come as my doctor.
And your mother made me a chemise and a nightgown.
I have to finish the design by tomorrow.
I think it could be a little lighter.
I like to look at you while you work.
In a one-handed slide rule contest, I'd win first prize for sure.
I think I can make each rib half an ounce lighter.
Thirty ribs makes about a pound.
Half a pound is enough for two.
I could eat a pound of mackerel by myself.
I'll keep holding your hand. You should sleep.
You won't let go? No, I won't.
I need a cigarette. Can I let go for a minute?
It's not good for you. I don't care.
Sure. How is your bomber? Coming along fine.
This is avant garde. You went all the way.
You've left the Germans behind. I'm still stuck with them.
This design is you, right down to the mackerel bones.
Jiro, let me use flush rivets too. And your spring-loaded hatches.
Yeah, but they're only letting me modify the fuselage.
That's where the fuel tanks are. One hit, and boom.
To save weight, we are not even shielding the fuel tanks.
It's Japan's first advanced bomber. The Navy is over the moon.
She's got to fly 3,000 kilometers with a big payload.
More horsepower alone won't be enough.
Who are they going to fight?
China. Russia. Britain. The Netherlands. America.
We're not arms merchants. We just want to build good aircraft.
It's finished. Now we'll see how she flies.
She is on her way to the field.
I'll probably spend a few nights there.
I'm sure it will fly beautifully.
I couldn't have done it without you.
I'm feeling much better today. I'm going for a walk.
Just be careful not to tire yourself.
The room is still a mess. I'll straighten up when I get back.
Kayo is coming today. That will be nice.
Look, she left letters. One of them is for me.
She is going to the sanatorium. I'll bring her back.
We shouldn't do anything until her train leaves.
She wants him to remember her as she was.
This is wonderful. Just think, that's one of ours.
Sorry, the numbers are too high. We're checking them again.
She flies like a dream. Thank you.
This is where we first met.
Or the land of the dead.
Not quite. In some ways, yes.
Those ten years in the sun, did you live them to the full?
Yes. Things fell apart toward the end, though.
That's what it means to lose a war.
There was nothing to come back to.
Airplanes are beautiful dreams. Cursed dreams...
waiting for the sky to swallow them up.
She's been waiting here for a long time.
She was beautiful, like the wind.
First, shall we drop by my house? I have some excellent wine.
A Tribute to Jiro Horikoshi and Tatsuo Hori
♪ Longing to be in the sky ♪
♪ A whole life, a vapor trail ♪
♪ All they could think was... ♪ ♪ "Too young" ♪
♪ Longing to be in the sky ♪
♪ A whole life, a vapor trail ♪
♪ Longing to be in the sky ♪
♪ A whole life, a vapor trail ♪
Theme Song Yumi Arai Music Joe Hisaishi
Dialogue Translation: Jim Hubbert & Rieko Izutsu-Vajirasarn
